roleset.name: make into a code, encrypt
roleset.note: CODE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'code' based on sentences in wsj. No Verbnet entry. (from code.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: topic detection
example.text: Pinpoint Information Corp., Chantilly, Va., a producer of $1,800-a-year personalized newsletters about the computer industry that started full operation last month, relies on [12 human readers]-2 [*-2]to code news releases by topic in order to select items for each subscriber.

example.name: more canonical usage
example.text: John codes all his love letters to Mary.
example.arg: all his love letters to Mary

example.name: Arg0, 1
example.text: Their coding of secret orders allowed them to infiltrate the enemy camp.

roleset.name: write software, writing computer programs
roleset.note: CODE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'code' based on sentences in wsj. No Verbnet entry. (from code.02-v predicate notes)

example.name: hack, hack, hack
example.text: John coded an artificial intelligence over lunch, but forgot to save the program.

example.name: Arg0, 1
example.text: Her coding of the Javascript program was fueled by massive amount of iced coffee.

roleset.name: medical patient being in cardiac arrest
roleset.note: CODING-N NOTES: from clinical notes (from coding.101-n)

example.name: Arg1
example.text: The patient's coding summoned a team of emergency doctors.
